title: Presentation: Saline and Sodic Soils: Understanding Differences and Management Solutions

tasks.task: Attend a seminar on soil health management for South Dakota farmers and ranchers.
subtasks: Learn about the effects of increased precipitation on soil health.
Understand the relationship between tillage practices and soil structure.
Discuss the impact of indigenous salts in the soil profile due to changes in precipitation patterns.
Evaluate management practices for saline and sodic soils, including cover crops and perennial systems.
Test for soil salinity and sodium using various methods and interpret the results.
Implement corrective actions such as gypsum and sulfur applications to improve soil structure.
Consider the timing and rate of amendments based on soil analysis and field conditions.
Assess the effectiveness of amendments through soil column studies and agricultural trials.
Understand the interaction between sodium levels and tillage in exacerbating soil dispersion issues.
